section.title: Situation analysis
section.para: The current ASF+SDF Meta-Environment is an interactive development environment for

defining domain-specific languages and the tools to support them, and
performing analysis and transformation of existing software.
See www.meta-environment.org for further details. The following are examples of the application of this technology:

listitem.para: Design and implementation of a domain-specific language for describing financial products. Starting with a two-page description of a desired (interest-based) financial product like a loan, a mortgage or a cash deposit, the required software support for that product is generated automatically.
Analyze C code that is embedded in a large industrial device for conformance to giving coding rules and report violations of these rules.
Find security errors in Java code.
Transform COBOL code to expand certain fields in data records (comparable to Year 2000 conversions).
Report 'dead code" (= unused code) in Java progams.
Build an interactive development environment for a specification formalism for mechanical devices and industrial plants.

section.para: Apart from the global applications of the system, several technologies that are used in its implementation are known and used by others:

listitem.para: ATerms: a tree-like datastructure used to represent intermediate data.
SGLR: a specific technique for syntax analysis.
ToolBus: our component interconnection technique.
Rscript: a sublanguage for relational computations.

section.para: The table Characterization of our technology gives a summary.
Some of the issues that we are currently facing are:

listitem.para: Although we have been delivering our software in an open source fashion for years now, the number of contributors outside CWI is still limited.
The system has been labelled "The ASF+SDF Meta-Environment" for many years, although this is not a very appealing name (not mentioning the fact that it hard to pronounce).
We have been sending two messages: "The ASF+SDF Meta-Environment is good" and "ATerms, SGLR, ToolBus, Rscript etc. are good". This weakens our profile.
The Meta-Environment provides basic infrastructure for a wide range of applications. It is easier to attract attention (and funding!) via application rather than via the infrastructure.

section.title: Goals

listitem.para: Increase the visibility of the Meta-Environment project.
Increase the number of users.
Increase the number of contributors.
Increase the number of scientific citations to publications related to the system.
Increase the number of references to the system in the popular press.
Attract funding for further research and development.
Build a stable open source community around the system.

is customized with text and colors. The following are the global requierments on the logo:

If we decide to have a mascotte, then it should be comtaible with the logo.

section.title: Timing and timelines
section.para: The natural moment to intensify our communication is with the 2.0 release of The Meta-Environment. We already have a release candidate but further improvement is necessary. An extensive launch in the spring of 2007 is in order. By the end of 2007 first effects should be visible.

section.title: Evaluation mechanisms
section.para: We will maintain this document to monitor progress of the various activities listed above.
We will also monitor values of the indicators listed in the section Goals.
